discourse_list.title: Breaking News! SEC charges 11 people in alleged $300 million crypto Ponzi scheme involving Forsage

content.content: As per the press release  Carolyn Welshhans, Acting Chief of the SEC’s Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit. “Fraudsters cannot circumvent the federal securities laws by focusing their schemes on smart contracts and blockchains.” The SEC has also charged three U.S.-based promoters who endorsed Forsage on their social media platforms. They were not named in the SEC release. Please stay vigilant out there all!    CNBC – 1 Aug 22    SEC charges 11 people in alleged $300 million crypto Ponzi scheme SEC charges 11 people in alleged $300 million crypto Ponzi scheme      In case anyone is doing business with any of the individuals, this is worth a look. https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2022-134
Here is the complaint naming everyone it seems:   sec.gov    comp-pr2022-134.pdf 2.83 MB

One of the few things that I support from regulation is the elimination of common ponzi schemes, which impresses me that people still believe that without investment without movement without adding anything productive to daily life they can earn something, I don’t want to speculate but if from 2020 they are warning and nothing was achieved I do not think this is the exception.    Cointelegraph    One Month On, Forsage Continues Despite SEC’s Ponzi Warnings Forsage members are courting a high risk with the Philippines' securities regulator      What brings me more curiosity is to know what networks promote it

Once you get to look behind the curtain, that is when it really gets interesting. If the case moves forward it will be intriguing to see what comes out in discovery. Being that this is a criminal matter, as opposed to a civil action, the discovery process should move much faster so more info should come out quickly. I expect more of this to come.
I don’t know much about them but their marketing strategy was really great. If you still search about Forsage over internet. You will get only positive things about them everywhere.
Wow, that is amazing. People looked at those positive things and got taken. What a mess.
